synsets.definition: Compulsive need to maintain social face and avoid public humiliation, driving behaviors that may be financially or personally destructive to preserve dignity and social standing
synsets.cultural_note: Chinese concept where loss of face creates irresistible urges to restore status, often leading to debt or overextension

synsets.definition: Overwhelming compulsion to avoid bringing shame to family or group, creating irresistible drives to conform or hide perceived failures even at personal cost
synsets.cultural_note: Japanese shame-based compulsion that can override individual wellbeing for collective honor

synsets.definition: Compulsive carrying of collective historical trauma and injustice, creating irresistible urges to sacrifice or suffer as expression of inherited pain
synsets.cultural_note: Korean concept of transmitted collective sorrow that compels individuals to embody cultural suffering

synsets.definition: Obsessive preoccupation with past-life debts creating compulsive ritual behaviors or extreme asceticism driven by belief in cosmic justice
synsets.cultural_note: Hindu/Buddhist concept where karmic anxiety creates compulsive spiritual or moral behaviors

synsets.definition: Compulsive engagement with spiritual trials or community conflicts, driven by belief that divine testing requires excessive devotion or martyrdom
synsets.cultural_note: Islamic concept where perception of divine trial creates compulsive religious or social behaviors

synsets.definition: Compulsive over-consideration of others' feelings leading to inability to refuse requests or express needs, creating destructive self-sacrifice patterns
synsets.cultural_note: Thai concept where excessive consideration becomes a compulsive inability to assert boundaries

synsets.definition: Overwhelming sense of social obligation creating compulsive fulfillment of duties even when personally destructive or financially ruinous
synsets.cultural_note: Japanese social duty that can become compulsively binding regardless of personal cost

synsets.definition: Compulsive maintenance of social networks through excessive gift-giving, favor-trading, or corrupt practices driven by fear of social isolation
synsets.cultural_note: Chinese relationship obligations that can become compulsively maintained through destructive means

synsets.definition: Compulsive adherence to conflicting moral duties creating paralysis or extreme behaviors when dharmic obligations contradict each other
synsets.cultural_note: Hindu concept of moral crisis that compels rigid adherence to duty despite impossible contradictions

synsets.definition: Obsessive monitoring and interpretation of others' moods and reactions, creating compulsive behavioral adjustments and social anxiety
synsets.cultural_note: Korean social awareness that can become compulsively hypervigilant and self-constraining

synsets.definition: Compulsive protection of family honor, especially female family members, driving controlling or violent behaviors justified as religious duty
synsets.cultural_note: Arabic concept of protective jealousy that can become compulsively controlling in family contexts

synsets.definition: Compulsive seeking of indulgent care from others, creating inability to function independently and manipulative dependency behaviors
synsets.cultural_note: Japanese concept of sweet dependency that can become compulsively manipulative and infantilizing

synsets.definition: Obsessive devotion to parents creating compulsive sacrifice of personal goals, marriage choices, or financial stability for parental approval
synsets.cultural_note: Chinese filial piety that can become compulsively self-destructive in modern contexts

synsets.definition: Compulsive attachment to material world despite philosophical belief in its illusory nature, creating cycles of indulgence and self-punishment
synsets.cultural_note: Hindu concept where awareness of illusion paradoxically creates compulsive engagement with it

synsets.definition: Compulsive performance of elaborate social courtesies creating exhausting behavioral patterns and inability to communicate directly
synsets.cultural_note: Persian ritual politeness that can become compulsively performed regardless of sincerity or practicality

synsets.definition: Compulsive self-sacrifice for community wellbeing, losing individual identity and agency in obsessive service to collective needs
synsets.cultural_note: African philosophy of interconnectedness that can become compulsively self-negating

synsets.definition: Compulsive deference to authority figures and hierarchical structures, creating inability to question or resist harmful leadership
synsets.cultural_note: Indonesian concept of father-figure authority that can become compulsively submissive

synsets.definition: Compulsive repayment of social debts creating lifelong obligations and inability to refuse requests from benefactors
synsets.cultural_note: Filipino concept of gratitude debt that can become compulsively binding across generations

synsets.definition: Obsessive responsibility for fixing world's problems creating compulsive activism, guilt, and burnout from impossible messianic expectations
synsets.cultural_note: Jewish concept of world repair that can become compulsively overwhelming and self-destructive

synsets.definition: Compulsive responsibility for all relations and beings, creating overwhelming burden and inability to set boundaries with people or nature
synsets.cultural_note: Lakota concept of universal kinship that can become compulsively burdensome

synsets.definition: Compulsive dwelling in melancholic nostalgia and impossible longing, creating inability to engage with present reality or relationships
synsets.cultural_note: Portuguese/Brazilian emotional state that can become compulsively consuming and paralyzing

synsets.definition: Compulsive performance of hypermasculine behaviors to maintain honor, creating destructive risk-taking and inability to show vulnerability
synsets.cultural_note: Latin American masculine ideal that can become compulsively performed regardless of consequences

synsets.definition: Compulsive pursuit of proportional justice and revenge, creating cycles of retaliation and inability to forgive or compromise
synsets.cultural_note: Islamic concept of just retribution that can become compulsively pursued beyond reason

synsets.definition: Obsessive avoidance of harm leading to paralysis in decision-making and compulsive self-punishment for any perceived violence
synsets.cultural_note: Hindu/Jain principle of non-harm that can become compulsively restrictive and self-punitive

synsets.definition: Compulsive protection and accumulation of spiritual power, creating rigid behavioral restrictions and fear of contamination or loss
synsets.cultural_note: Polynesian concept of spiritual energy that can become compulsively guarded and constraining
